bloc1.title: The story
bloc1.description: The Wahta’ school is an elementary school in the Huron-Wendat community. It welcomes all students from its community and those residing in Wendake, from kindergarten 4 years old to 6th grade. It stands out for its culture and the fact that it is a school of choice committed to its community, listening to the needs and ensuring the success of each one. The Classe-Musée portal was born from an educational project carried out to create augmented reality projects with students. By experimenting with augmented reality, it quickly became clear that this tool has the potential to inform on any subject. You can use it in tourism, culture, education and at the commercial level to carry out stimulating projects using augmented reality.

bloc2.title: Start
bloc2.description: Start according to your needs and ambitions with our packages that grow with you, or ask for a quote for solutions adapted to your environment, whether at school, at the museum or even in business.

bloc3.title: For whom
bloc3.description: PORTAIL CLASSE-MUSÉE respects both the independent user and the one who wants a turnkey solution. In fact, we want to democratize access to augmented reality as well as other services of the same nature such as 360-3D virtual tours, games for learning while having fun, animated video, etc.

bloc4.description: ACT 25: The person responsible for the protection of personal information is Mr. XXXX, whom you can contact at info@edu.wendake.ca at any time. Wahta’ School will take rapid measures in the event of a data leak to minimize the risks and inform the Commission d’accès à l’information du Québec and the persons concerned. An incident register will also be kept and available upon request.

resources.title: Augmented reality
resources.subtitle: Mobile application and programming
resources.description: Do you have a project? We have the solution!

bloc1.title: Mobile application
bloc1.description: The Wahta' mobile application allows you to access your project and view the visitor-customer-user experiences created and programmed in augmented reality

bloc2.title: Our programming platform
bloc2.description: The platform will allow you to easily program multiple AR projects that will be available for free and automatically in private or public mode. In places with difficult Wi-Fi access, you will be able to view your project on your digital device after downloading it, even on top of a mountain!

conf.title: Privacy Policy
conf.description1: This privacy policy applies to the site
conf.description2: and the WAHTA application, both of which are owned by Jean-Philippe Payer. Its purpose is to inform users about the personal data collected and how it is used. It also details the commitment and measures taken to ensure the security of the latter.
conf.paragraph1-1: Gabriel Chalifour is the developer of the site
conf.paragraph1-2: as well as the WAHTA application.
conf.subtitle2: Usefulness of the application and website
conf.paragraph2: The website is used to create augmented reality projects and experiences in education, culture, tourism, and commerce that will be used by users in various environments using the WAHTA application. Jean-Philippe Payer owns all rights to the mobile application and the web platform. WAHTA or Jean-Philippe Payer are not responsible for the augmented realities created and used by users of the programming packages. Any content programmed by users that is illicit, sexist, homophobic, sexual, or physically or verbally violent is not the responsibility of Jean-Philippe Payer or WAHTA. Consequently, Jean-Philippe Payer or WAHTA cannot be held responsible for the programming of the content and cannot be sued by anyone.
conf.paragraph3-2: , we automatically collect information about your device and your interaction with our site through the Google Analytics tool. This includes the following data:
conf.itemList4: Links that the user clicks on
conf.paragraph3-3: Other data is collected non-automatically during one of the following actions:
conf.itemList8: Adding and Editing Users to an Account
conf.itemList13: Password to log in to our website
conf.paragraph4: The WAHTA application requires access to the camera and storage of the device on which it is installed but does not collect or process any personal information of the user. The application loads and processes on the user's device only the projects created by him or other users on the web platform.
conf.paragraph5-1: The data we collect on our website is for the purpose of offering you a portal for creating and modifying educational projects. Projects that will subsequently be available on the WAHTA application.
conf.paragraph5-2: Projects created on this platform are composed of a sequential project number, a name and various elements such as: images, sounds, videos, pdfs, 3d models or internet links. This data is saved on our platform as well as on Amazon's AWS service.
conf.paragraph5-3: The WAHTA application simply retrieves this data to copy it to the user's device in order to display it in their real environment through the camera or, in the case of pdf or web links, through the device's browser or viewer.
conf.paragraph5-4: In addition, the data collected through Google Analytics is for the purpose of generating statistics to improve the user experience on the site.
conf.subtitle6-1: What is a cookie and how are cookies used?
conf.paragraph6-1: Cookies are files created by your web browser to remember your preferences and actions on the websites you visit. They do not contain personal information but allow us to store data such as the items in your shopping cart or your login settings. Cookies collect information to improve visitors' online experience by helping us understand how they use our websites, including the number of visits, the origins of visitors and the devices or browsers used. This data helps ensure optimal access to the sites on users' preferred devices. The information collected by cookies helps us gather information about visitors' preferences and how they interact with our content. With this data, we can offer relevant information from the start of their visit to the site. Although the information collected via cookies does not allow you to be personally identified, with your permission, we can identify you if you log in to one of our websites or applications. The 'cookies' used by the site are as follows:
conf.paragraph6-2: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled. They include basic preferences such as language and session, and are essential for evaluating the site's performance. Their authorization is required to use the site, although you can block them in your browser. These cookies do not store any personal information.
conf.paragraph6-3: These cookies collect data about your interaction with our services to measure things like length of visit, part of the site visited and traffic sources. This information helps us improve performance and content by creating better features for a better online experience. The data collected is anonymous, aggregated and not used for advertising or profiling purposes. We may use cookies to know your preferences and track your activities on the website
conf.subtitle7: Sharing information with a third party
conf.paragraph7-1: At no time do we sell or rent your personal information to third parties as required by law.
conf.paragraph7-2: However, we reserve the right to communicate your personal information in cases required by law, in the context of legal acts, in response to the request of authorities responsible for the application of the Law.
conf.paragraph8-1: User data from the Classe-Musée Wahta website can be viewed, processed and collected from anywhere in the world. However, it is only available in the following languages:
conf.paragraph8-2: The WAHTA application is only accessible from the following countries: South Africa, Germany, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Finland, France, Haiti, Morocco, Mexico, Norway, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, Peru, Switzerland, Turkey, Egypt, United States in the languages:
conf.paragraph9-1: We only retain your personal information for as long as it is reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this policy or as required by law. You can contact us at
conf.paragraph9-2: if you wish to make changes or delete the data associated with you.
conf.paragraph10: In the event of a leak of your personal data, we undertake to keep you informed as well as the Commission d’accès à l’Information du Québec.
conf.subtitle11: User Rights and Data Protection Officer
conf.paragraph11-1: If you are a resident of Quebec, in accordance with Law 25, you benefit from specific rights concerning your personal data:
conf.itemList25: Droit à la portabilité des données
conf.paragraph11-2: Vous avez le droit de vous opposer à l’utilisation de vos données et de les retirer.
conf.paragraph11-3: Pour exercer ces droits, contactez notre responsable de la protection des données personnelles :
conf.paragraph12: You can consult, modify or delete your data by contacting the personal data protection officer at the contact details above.
conf.paragraph13: You can visit our site without revealing your identity. However, some features require the collection of personal data. You always have the choice not to provide this information. You do not need to reveal your identity when browsing the WAHTA Application.
conf.paragraph14: Law 25 specifies that persons under the age of 14 are considered minors for the purposes of data collection. Their personal information may not be collected from them without the consent of the holder of parental authority or guardian, except when this collection will clearly be for the benefit of this minor.
conf.itemList29: Parental supervision is strongly recommended when the application is used by children or minors.
conf.paragraph15: The Wahta Class-Museum website and the WAHTA application may contain links to other sites. We are not responsible for their privacy practices and policies.
conf.paragraph16-1: If you have any questions regarding this privacy policy, you can contact us
conf.paragraph16-2: By using our WAHTA application, you agree to the terms of this privacy policy.

droits.title: Rights and Use
droits.description: You acknowledge that you use the information and data, including scores, reports, data and statistics, provided through this website at your sole and exclusive risk. Under no circumstances will Wahta’ or the Wahta’ Released Parties involved in creating, producing or delivering this website or the content contained herein be liable for any loss, injury, claim, liability or damage of any kind resulting in any way from: (a) any content or material downloaded from this website; (b) any links provided on this website; (c) any errors or omissions in the data found on this website; (d) the unavailability or delay of such data; or (e) your use of the data found on this website or any conclusions you draw therefrom, whether or not you have received any assistance from Wahta’ or its employees with respect to such data. You hereby agree to release and hold harmless Wahta’ and its parties released for all matters described in this section.
